intro: [WRONG START] Gelonia glomerulatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are narrow, slightly hairy, and arranged in a rosette pattern. Gelonia glomerulatum is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
